question: In which year, the Supreme Court of Judicature was established at Calcutta?
explanation: In pursuance of the power given by the Regulating Act, 1773, the Crown issued a Charter on March 26,1774, establishing the Supreme Court of Judicature at Calcutta. The Charter settled the various details relating to the Court, and abolished the legal provisions of the Charter of 1753. As per the Regulating act, the Supreme Court was to work as a Court of Record. It consisted of a Chief Justice and three Puisne Judges to be appointed by the Crown lo act during the pleasure of the Crown. The Charter appointed Sir Elijah Imply as the Chief Justice, and Robert Clambers, S.C. Le Maistre and John Hyde as the three Puisne Judges.
